Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the images are genuine NASA photos of Earth seen from space, without verifying their authenticity.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide substantial evidence or supporting information to prove the authenticity of the images.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim suggests that the images are 3D renderings created by an artist using textures provided by NASA, which contradicts the initial assumption that they are actual NASA photos.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the initial assumption that the images are genuine NASA photos by stating that they are 3D renderings created by an artist.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the significance or credibility of the images by associating them with NASA, even though they are not actual NASA photos.
